title: AI Disk & Storage Performance
description: Optimize dataset I/O and resolve low disk space issues hindering AI training.

steps.title: Clean Temp Files
steps.instruction: Run 'Disk Cleanup' or delete %TEMP% folder contents. AI frameworks create large temp files that can fill the drive.

steps.title: Use SSD for Datasets
steps.instruction: Move datasets to an NVMe or SATA SSD. Training from a mechanical HDD causes significant I/O wait times.

steps.title: Optimize Data Loading
steps.instruction: Increase 'num_workers' in your DataLoader to parallelize data reading, or use compressed formats like LMDB/HDF5.

steps.title: Check Disk Health
steps.instruction: Run 'chkdsk /f' or use CrystalDiskInfo. A failing drive will drop in speed significantly under high read/write load.

steps.title: Monitor I/O Queue
steps.instruction: Resource Monitor → Disk tab → Check 'Active Time' and 'Disk Queue Length'. High queue length indicates an I/O bottleneck.
